website_summaries.verdict: The Polk Audio UltraFocus 6000's noise-canceling powers are just average for an in-ear NC design, but anyone looking for midprice headphones with lots of bass and detail will love this set.
pros: The Polk Audio UltraFocus 6000 active noise-canceling in-ear headphones feature a big, powerful sound while maintaining a comfortable fit
cons: The cable lacks a microphone and smartphone controls, and playback requires power, so the music dies along with your battery

website_summaries.verdict: The Polk Audio UltraFocus 6000 earphone pair delivers excellent noise cancellation, but its bulky battery compartment and audio performance quirks are drawbacks.
pros: Powerful audio performance with deep bass, no distortion at top volumes
Comes with a multitude of eartips in varying shapes and sizes
cons: Doesn't output audio in passive mode
Audio can sound muffled on certain tracks
External battery and NC circuitry compartment is bulky, awkward
Uses AAA battery, not a rechargeable options

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars for sound clarity
customer_reviews.text: Not the best noise cancellation headset. I did an extensive search on bose quite comfort, sennheiser, and polk. I decided to settle on polk ultra focus 6000 cos of the following reasons: Value for money Awesome sound clarity(better than bose, hands down) Passive sound cancellation is good enough Cons: Not the best white noise cancellation device. I feel its worth the money and a really good sounding headset.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy. Better headphones out there for less
customer_reviews.text: Needs to have charged battery in to work at all. Without battery, music is barely audible and definitely not worth listening to. With charged battery, it's passable. Not worth the money. And noise-cancelling is almost non-existent. My Audio-Technica ATH-ANC23 in ear noise-cancelling work way better for less.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping these headphones would block out more of the outside sound than they do. They're fine at the gym, but on an airplane, I think you'd really have to crank up the sound. They do come with several styles of ear adaptors, and I've tried most of them. Maybe I'll try another style and see if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: Poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had two sets of these earphones - on both the battery door fell off which makes it a hassle to use (the battery then falls out unless you tape over it). I travel a lot and I do like the noise cancellation (even though it is not as good as Bose) but I cannot live with the price point considering this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Musiclover

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are the BEST I have found in audio quality to use with my iPad, especially for watching movies while on long flights. They also have amplification and noise canceling built in. Built for individual comfort (comes with several different size earpieces) and a nice zippered case.
customer_reviews.author: Craig B. Highberger

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have always like Polk Audio and the products that they make but the volume control was way too big and the ear buds will not control an ipod or a android device this was a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: JoJo

customer_reviews.title: Polk Audio Ultra Focus 6000
customer_reviews.text: a short review, i've only had them for a week but they sound great and have excellent build quality. The only thing that I don't like is that once the battery dies, they are completely non-functional.
customer_reviews.author: Ben L.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Very effective.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned about the effectiveness of earbud style noise canceling headphones, but these are very good. Not as good as some the higher priced over ear (Bose) models out there, but still very good.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: static
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about the product but I cannot recommend these. I'll be sending them back and not replacing. The amount of static I hear completely unacceptable. Also these phones do not have a volume adjustment to regulate the music player's output. The noise canceling feature works well and the music is acceptable for sub $100 headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Karel

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Not as effective as over the ear headphones. Nice for walking on a busy street. The main unit is heavy and needs to be secured to keep from pulling the plugs out of your ears.
customer_reviews.author: Expernow

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, comfortable, and very good noise supression. (My wife think's too effective!) Now if I can just remember where I put them after our last trip!
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It helps me to keep 90% of the noice out of my eras.
customer_reviews.author: cui

customer_reviews.title: Great noise cancelling headphones
customer_reviews.text: They sound great, they have lots of different ear pieces to let you get a good, comfortable fit, and the wires are made to reduce tangling. I travel a lot and really appreciate the noise cancelling in a small package. The only downside is they they don't work with a dead battery. Just carry a spare. I just bought another set for a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Greg T Roberts

customer_reviews.title: I was totally disappointed in these and won't buy Polk again
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones because I thought they were noise canceling but they were not at all. Also, they are heavy and the wires are inflexible and heavy. I was totally disappointed in these and won't buy Polk again.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Holiday

customer_reviews.title: good for in the ear buds
customer_reviews.text: When I was 20 hours in the plane going across the Pacific Ocean, I experienced the noise reduction qualities of these headphones. They blocked that constant noise well, and I was able to enjoy the movies and music from both my iPad and the airplane entertainment program. The kit included the special attachment for the two-pronged plug used in airplanes. The sound was crisp and clear, and the noise around was vastly reduced. I felt they were as good as 'over the ear' headphones. There was a big choice of foam/plastic covers for the earphones, and the ones I chose were comfortable for the long trip. Has a convenient case for storing the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Sunam

customer_reviews.title: Complete Junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Discontinued and they should be. The cord was insanely thick ribbon and earbuds look tacky with the shiny plastic and chrome. In the days of cool-looking headsets, makes you look like a total geek. Noise reduction was mostly passive and attributed to the dense foam. Died within a week, and Amazon returned my money.
customer_reviews.author: hiroxbmw

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for IPod
customer_reviews.text: I bought these along with IPod gen 4 for my daughter for Christmas. She really likes them very much. A bit expensive (Just over $100.00) but well worth the price for the sound and quality!
customer_reviews.author: Jody Noller

customer_reviews.title: Too Big
customer_reviews.text: I have I guess I smaller size ear. I couldn't get any of the included ear buds to fit in my ear, but it wasn't the ear buds fault. The back end piece that says Polk on it, wouldn't fit down in my ear and force the seals out. I returned these and took the $5.00 cut, which is something that I rarely do. I don't know about sound quality or any of that. I could never actually use them.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Good for most applications
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a good choice if you can get them for $60 or less. Noise cancelling is good enough for a cube-farm office environment. They come with a nice variety of ear tips, so you should be able to find something that fits. The earbuds are quite a bit heavier than most earbuds, but are still comfortable for extended use (I use mine 5-7 hours a day). I use rechargeable 800mAh NiMH AAA batteries in the controller and they last at least a week (25-30 hours of use). Downside: They are absolute rubbish outdoors if it is windy. The noise cancelling function actually amplifies wind noise, totally obliterating the audio feed.
customer_reviews.author: James Gerber

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: The left ear bud had a very high amount of static/buzzing that took away from the sound of the music. The first time I pulled the connector out of my surround sound system the connector stayed in place and the electronics/wiring pulled completely away from the jack. Being that it was not a tight fit I'm really unsure of how this could have happened after just one use. Returned product for refund.
customer_reviews.author: boogie pilgrim

customer_reviews.title: Need better bass
customer_reviews.text: Pros: They're pretty comfortable. Noise canceling works OK. Overall sound definition is good. They come with a nice zip pouch and lots of ear=size adaptors. Cons: Bass is rather weak, and they don't compare well sound-wise with on-the ear Grado phones at comprable price.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Nelson MD

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Don't consider buying these.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are expensive junk. The moronic and cumbersome clip broke after 2, count 'em 2, uses. That in my book = zero durability. The on-off switch is heavy and idiotically located in a place on the cord where it is a constant bother, in other words use of this clip is almost mandatory. If you are doing anything other than sitting nicely and quietly in a chair forget it. Last but not least, who in the world needs yet another device with batteries? Lesson learned, I will never purchase anything made by Polk aka people who massively failed design 101 spectacularly. If I was able to award negitive 5 stars i would have.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Bought it as an alternate to my other noise cancelling headphones (Sony, Bose), but ended up using it more than the others. I'm really happy that I got it (and at a great price, too!).
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Valarao

product_meta.title: Polk UltraFocus 6000
product_meta.description: A Great Performance Requires UltraFocus The power of music to motivate, inspire and refresh is undeniable. Now it's easier than ever for anyone who leads a hectic, fast-paced life to find that escape (or motivation). The UltraFocus 6000 is an in-ear canal design that creates amazing sound because of what you won't hear. And what you do. The comfortable, in-ear-canal design seals the ear minimizing outside sound, while the active noise canceling eliminates virtually all distractions from the environment around you. When you combine these noise isolating features with our Dynamic Balance driver technology, you have a pair of headphones that recreate an exceptional listening experience, with detail, full fidelity and deep bass for a truly life like and inspiring performance. In addition, there's a push-to-hear ambient control that mutes the audio and amplifies outside sounds, so you can hear those around you without removing the headphones. While Secure Fit support and a generous assortment of ear tip materials and sizes means you're assured of finding a snug yet comfortable in-ear canal fit.
feature_bullets: Audiophile Performance Digital Sound- Exceptional detail, full fidelity & deep bass impact for life like performance
Active Noise Canceling-Battery-assisted true active noise canceling eliminates the distractions of the outside world (battery included)
Ultra Fidelity Dynamic Balance Transducers- Polk's proprietary driver technology s full frequency response while minimizing distortion
Easily Accessible In-Line Controller-Easy to use control of the volume and push-to-hear technology
Push-To-Hear Ambient Control-Mutes the audio and amplifies outside sounds so you can hear without removing the headphones

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK ( ). We will only be able to confirm if this product can be delivered to your chosen address when you enter your delivery address at checkout.
